alert.note: Alert for Culpeper; Fauquier; Page; Rappahannock; Shenandoah; Warren (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 12 at 5:33PM EDT until July 12 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM EDT FOR EAST CENTRAL SHENANDOAH...SOUTHERN WARREN...NORTHEASTERN PAGE... RAPPAHANNOCK...NORTHWESTERN FAUQUIER AND NORTH CENTRAL CULPEPER COUNTIES... At 533 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Sperryville, or 12 miles south of Front Royal, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Warrenton, Sperryville, Hume, Marshall, Chester Gap, Opal, Flint Hill, Washington, Huntly, Hackleys Crossroads, Amissville, Jeffersonton, Cresthill, Turnbull, Glen Echo, Bentonville, Meadowville, Rock Mills, Rileyville and Kimball. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Culpeper; Fauquier; Page; Rappahannock; Shenandoah; Warren
